event.desc: The first performance of the symphony took place in the second part of the program. Before that, the ouverture of Die Weihe des Hauses, op. 124 and excerpts from the Missa solemnis, op. 123 were performed.
Wagner’s first performance of the Ninth is described in the literature as a milestone in the reception history of the work.

expression.title: Allegro assai vivace alla marcia – „Froh, wie seine Sonne fliegen”
Allegro energico e sempre ben marcato – „Freude, schöner Götterfunken”
expression.tempo: Allegro energico e sempre ben marcato

expression.title: Allegro ma non tanto – „Tochter aus Elysium”

physDesc.physMedium: 137 folios (sequence of double leaves, single leaves: fol. 58, 69, 116, 121, 122), 16–23 staves, 23,5x31,0 cm (trimmed), at least three different types of paper with watermarks of the paper mill Anton Kiesling und Söhne ("A K & S), yellowish to light grey paper. Autograph notation with ink, lead and red chalk. Fol. 67v–68v, 71v, 114v–115v are blank.
physDesc.condition: Fol. 1r and 49v heavier soiling; occasional minor loss of text as a result of trimming during binding. Traces of previous binding near the folds.

titlePage.label: cover
titlePage.p: Sinfonie No 9. | von | L. van Beethoven. | Handschrift des Componisten

binding.p: Half leather binding from the 19th century, covers coated with red paper.

supportDesc.foliation: Layer counting for movements I-III with ruddle. The manuscript has been foliated from 1–136 in pencil in the upper right corners by the library. One supplementary sheet was skipped and subsequently counted as "17a".
